pullRequest.title: GEOS-9457: Restore the usage instruction of Windows Installer (only add ref to dev manual)
pullRequest.bodyText:
Below the list of available binaries, I added a note which:

states GeoServer not longer provides the Windows Installers
tells the user can create the Windows Installer themselves when needed

This way we hope to get fewer questions about the 'missing' Windows Installer in the download section.
Checklist

 Confirm you have read the contribution guidelines
 You have sent a Contribution Licence Agreement (CLA) as necessary (not required for small changes, e.g., fixing typos in documentation)
 Make sure the first PR targets the master branch, eventual backports will be managed later. This can be ignored if the PR is fixing an issue that only happens in a specific branch, but not in newer ones.

commit.message: GEOS-9457: Added reference to instructions for building the Windows Installer and stating it's not longer provided

nodes.bodyText:
The wording is misleading, it's not the cost benefit per se, we need:

A well secured Windows server managed by a trusted organization that can host the OSGeo certificate used to sign installers. This alone would reinstate the presence of the installer in releases.
Someone to redo the installer from scratch, using Tomcat  instead of a reduced Jetty, to get a production worthy installer, instead of a demo oriented one. Not needed, but useful for those that actually want to run production on Windows.
